page.title: 17THE MILLDAM TODAY
page.content: The{Milldam}is low lying in a shallow valley.The area has been drained of water which used to feed the mill at Elwick. The rich mud soon became filled with vegetation.Clumps of{sedge grass}and {mares tails}cover the ground at the wettest parts.{Bogbean}also loves this swampy habitat.On the drier edges,in the early summer,grow bright splashes of{golden marshmarigold}and {buttercups}.Hidden in the long grass can be found the deep purple{northern {marsh orchid,}as well as the taller paler{lady's smock}.Specimens of {greaterswearwart, tormentil}and{dog {violet}also grow there.The{Milldam}is a favourite nesting site for{black {headed gulls}which swoop and squawk, noisily guarding their territory.They never seem to stop.This is a good place for{nature}research.
